document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Hoplasoma (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) of the Philippines, with descriptions of five new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Lectotype 3 ( BMNH ), designated here, labelled: “ Type [white round label with red collar] // M. R. Belg. [w, p] // Coll. Chapuis [w, p] // Luzon / Semper. [yellow label, p] // Jacoby Coll. /
1909 – 28
a. [w, p] // Hoplasoma / philippinensis / Type Jac. [blue label, p]”. Paralectotypes : 3 ( BMNH ), labelled: “Luzon / Semper. [yellow label, p] // Coll. Chapuis [w, p] // M. R. Belg. [w, p] // Jacoby Coll. /
1909 – 28
a. [w, p]”; Ƥ ( BMNH ), labelled: “Luzon / Semper. [yellow label, p] // Coll. Chapuis [w, p] // Jacoby Coll. /
1909 – 28
a. [w, p]”; 3 ( ISNB ), labelled: “Luzon / Semper. [yellow label, p] // Coll. Chapuis [w, p] // M. R. Belg. [w, p] // Haplosoma / philippinensis / Jac. [blue label, h] //
TYPE
[pink label, p] // M. Jacoby det.: / HOPLASOMA / philippinensis Jac. [w, p] // cf. Ann. Soc. Ent. / Belg., [p] 1894, 38 [h] / p. 197 [w, p] // V. Laboissière [p] vid. [h], 1939 : [p] / Hoplasoma / philippinensis / Type 3 Jac. [w, h]”; Ƥ ( ISNB ), labelled: “Luzon / Semper. [yellow label, p] // Coll. Chapuis [w, p] // M. R. Belg. [w, p] // M. Jacoby det.: / HOPLASOMA / philippinensis Jac. [w, p] // Para– / type [orange label, p] // cf.

Ann. Soc. Ent. / Belg., [p] 1894, 38 [h] / p. 197 [w, p] // V. Laboissière [p] vid. [h], 1939 : [p] / Hoplasoma / philippinensis / Jac. / Paratype Ƥ [w, h]”; 3 33 ( ISNB ), labelled: “Luzon / Semper. [yellow label, p] // Coll. Chapuis [w, p] // M. R. Belg. [w, p] // M. Jacoby det.: / HOPLASOMA / philippinensis Jac. [w, p] // Para– / type [orange label, p] // cf. Ann. Soc. Ent. / Belg., [p] 1894, 38 [h] / p. 197 [w, p] // HOPLASOMA / philippinensis Jac. [p] / V. Laboissiere vid., 1939 : [w, p]”. The specimens are provided with one red printed label: “ LECTOTYPUS [or PARALEC- TOTYPUS], / Hoplasoma /
philippinensis
Jacoby, 1894
, / des.
J. Bezdĕk 2006
”.

The colour photographs of a paralectotype (Ƥ, not examined) and its labels, deposited in the Museum of Comparative Zoology, Harvard, are available online at: http://mcz- 28168 .oeb.harvard.edu/mcztypedb.htm. This paralectotype bears the following labels: “Luzon [w, h] // 2 nd Jacoby / Coll. [w, p] // philippinensis Jac. [w, h] // Type [p] 17585 [red label, h]”.

Additional material studied.
70 specimens
— PHILIPPINES ( LUZON IS.): RIZAL PROV .: 1 3 2 ƤƤ, Montalban [= Rodriguez municipality], without the date of collecting, Böttcher leg. ( ZMHB ); METRO MANILA:
3 33 2
ƤƤ, Manila, without additional data ( ZMHB ); 1 3 , Manila, without additional data ( BMNH ); 2 33 , Manila, 1903 , without additional data ( BMNH ); ILOCO SUR PROV .:
9 33 11
ƤƤ, Iloco Sur Prov., without the date of collecting, McGregor leg. ( USNM ); BATAAN PROV .:
2 33 1
Ƥ, Limay, without the date of collecting, R. C. McGregor leg. ( USNM ); LAGUNA PROV .,
8 33 4
ƤƤ, Makiling Mt., without the date of collecting, Baker leg. ( USNM ); 1 3 1 Ƥ, Los Banos, without the date of collecting, Baker leg. ( USNM );
6 33 3
ƤƤ, Banahao Mt., without the date of collecting, Baker leg. ( USNM ); 1 3 , Banahao Mt., Ube, without the date of collecting, McGregor leg. ( USNM ); CAVITE PROV .: 1 3 , Silang,
5 .ix. 1924
, R. C. McGregor leg. ( USNM ); BENGUET PROV .: 1 3 , Baguio, without the date of collecting, Baker leg. ( USNM ); 1 Ƥ, Irisan, without the date of collecting, McGregor leg. ( USNM ); ISABELA PROV .: 1 3 , San Mariano, without the date of collecting, McGregor leg. ( USNM ); NUEVA VIZCAYA PROV .: 1 Ƥ, Dupax,
iii. 1912
, McGregor leg. ( USNM ); PROVINCE?: 2 33 , Philippines , Semper leg., without additional data ( ISNB ); 1 3 1 Ƥ, Luzon, without additional data ( BMNH ); 1 Ƥ, Luzon, without additional data ( MNHN ) [ paralectotype of
H. picifemora
]; 1 3 , Luzon, 1934 , L.M. Phillips leg. ( BMNH ); 1 Ƥ, North Luzon, Whitehead leg. ( BMNH ). DOUBTFUL LOCALITY: 1 3 , Panaon Isl., without the date of collecting, Semper leg. ( ISNB ); INDONESIA : 2 33 , Celebes, without additional data ( BMNH ); KOREA : 1 3 , Corea , without additional data ( BMNH ).
Description. Colour orange; apices of mandibles black; abdomen black, often with brownish base of first ventrite, appendages and extreme posterior margin of all ventrites.

Male (
Fig. 7
). Labrum transverse, anterior margin slightly concave. Interocular space narrow, 0.88 times as wide as transverse diameter of eye. Length ratio of antennomeres 1 to 11 equals
32 - 9-25 - 30
- 30 - 29 - 29 - 27 - 27 - 25-28 .
Pronotum 1.38 times as broad as long, widest at anterior quarter. Anterior margin almost straight.
Elytra shiny, 2.15 times as long as wide and 0.65 times as long as body; apex right-angled, tips slightly protruding.

Protarsomere 1 enlarged, 1.15 times as wide as protarsomere 2 . Width of protarsomere 1 highly variable, being relatively slender to very wide (length/width ratio 1.55-1.85 ). Length ratio of protarsomeres 1–4 equals
22 - 17 - 9- 19
. Metatarsomere 1 enlarged, 1.55 times as wide as metatarsomere 2 . Width of metatarsomere 1 varies from relatively slender to very wide (length/width ratio 1.65-2.30 ). Length ratio of metatarsomeres 1–4 equals
30 - 19 - 12-27
.

Differential diagnosis. Basally fused abdominal appendages differentiate
H. konstantinovi
sp. nov.
,
H. mindanense
and
H. philippinense
from all other
Hoplasoma
species in the Philippines (
Figs 11, 14, 15
).
H. philippinense
can be separated easily from the other two species by its black abdomen (abdomen orange in
H. konstantinovi
sp. nov.
and
H. mindanense
). Median lobe of aedeagus is long and narrow and cannot be confused with the same in any other Philippine species. Posterior margin of last female ventrite is strongly rounded (or with indistinct angulation laterally) in
H. philippinense
(
Fig. 31
). Only in
H. mindanense
the last female ventrite is similarly shaped (
Fig. 30
). However, the distinct lateral angulations and the orange color of the abdomen are useful in separating females of
H. mindanense
from that of
H. philippinense .
Distribution. The Philippines (Luzon). Identity of the specimen from Panaon Isl. is doubtful. The specimens from Sulawesi and Corea are either mislabelled or accidentally transported.

Comments. The ending of the species name has been modified as “
philippinense
” to agree in gender with the generic name.
